intro: Odostemon zimapanus, commonly known as the Zimapan wild cucumber, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant features trailing stems with heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Its botanical characteristics make it a unique species within the gourd family, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Odostemon zimapanus is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ecological and potential medicinal properties.
